alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:42PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Albany County through 830 PM MDT... At 742 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 10 miles west of Laramie, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bosler around 805 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 293 and 309. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range
